results.title: Men's voices: Digital Storytelling project (Arabic men)
results.brief_description: Nine young men from various Arabic backgrounds share their stories and memories of family, country and culture through this ACMI digital storytelling workshop held on 10-12 October 2007, sponsored by Mens Line Australia.
results.description: Nine young men from various Arabic backgrounds share their stories and memories of family, country and culture through this ACMI digital storytelling workshop held on 10-12 October 2007, sponsored by Mens Line Australia.
description_for_label: Nine young men from various Arabic backgrounds share their stories and memories of family, country and culture through this ACMI digital storytelling workshop held on 10-12 October 2007, sponsored by Mens Line Australia.

results.title: Waiting to laugh
results.creator_credit: Hamid Naemi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Now settled in Australia, Afghani born Hamid reflects on the difficult and lonely times he and his sister experienced when they moved to Iran after their mother’s unexpected disappearance and their father’s death one year later.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hamid Naemi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Now settled in Australia, Afghani born Hamid reflects on the difficult and lonely times he and his sister experienced when they moved to Iran after their mother’s unexpected disappearance and their father’s death one year later.
description_for_label: Now settled in Australia, Afghani born Hamid reflects on the difficult and lonely times he and his sister experienced when they moved to Iran after their mother’s unexpected disappearance and their father’s death one year later.

results.title: The Ties that bind
results.creator_credit: Milad Bardan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It took seven years after the death of his mother and a political assassination in his birth country of Lebanon before Milad really got to know his father. This is a tribute to that man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milad Bardan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: It took seven years after the death of his mother and a political assassination in his birth country of Lebanon before Milad really got to know his father. This is a tribute to that man.
description_for_label: It took seven years after the death of his mother and a political assassination in his birth country of Lebanon before Milad really got to know his father. This is a tribute to that man.

results.title: Read this title
results.creator_credit: Tristan Tatenhou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: What if…This entertaining story is told through simple drawings, text and commentary by the narrator who describes chunks of his life in a somewhat cynical but humourous way.

results.title: My Scar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Fabris, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A touching story of the emotional highs and lows in life and the processes used to heal the scars, both in mind and body.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Fabris, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My life to study
results.creator_credit: Fei Hu Song, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Fei Hu Song and his family came from China to Australia, they all took English language courses. This began for Hu Song a lifetime of study and of making Australia his home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fei Hu Song, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Fei Hu Song and his family came from China to Australia, they all took English language courses. This began for Hu Song a lifetime of study and of making Australia his home.

results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.

results.title: A Different type of game
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hodges, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The games men play - how cricket and the Aussie male ethos played a major part in Stephen’s adolescent years and on into his adult life. He learnt to play the game and the game never dies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Hodges, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The games men play - how cricket and the Aussie male ethos played a major part in Stephen’s adolescent years and on into his adult life. He learnt to play the game and the game never dies.
